Speaker.introduction:
Adam Backman is the Managing Partner of White Star Software, LLC. He is responsible for database and system planning, tuning and administration. This includes providing training, consulting services for a worldwide client base.

Additionally, Adam is a Partner at DBAppraise, LLC. DBAppraise is the premier database and system monitoring service serving the Progress/OpenEdge community.

Adam brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to each of his client's business issues and uses a logical, business-centric approach in his work.

Adam is the author of a book on creating a comprehensive recovery strategy for users of Progress Software's RDBMS called "Who cares if you have a good Backup if you can't Recover?". He also authored a book for Progress Software's Expert Series called "OpenEdge Revealed".

Adam presented on a wide range of topics at Progress Software User's conferences and user group meetings for over 20 years.

Adam is a Team Lead at Yonder, company part  of the TSS group. During the past 8 years he has been working with Progress technology on several major frameworks developed by the company and also on challenging projects with demanding requirements from the customers.

Adrian is a cluster manager on Progress technology at a firm that is part of the TSS group, called Yonder. During the 6 years since he has been working with Progress technology he not only attended, but also spoke at several IT events, sharing his passion for all IT technologies and also his interest in facing new challenges when it comes to software innovation and new trends in IT.

Brian has been in IT for more than 40 years, from the days of paper tape and punch cards. After early work in Real Time Systems and then in commercial software, Brian formed BCP Ltd in the early 80s. BCP adopted Progress in 1989 and soon converted all BCP products to Progress. Appointed full-time R & D Director about eleven years ago and Retail Technical Director eight years ago, Brian has since instigated most of the technology innovations now in use at BCP. His current interest is the development of hybrid mobile apps using OpenEdge Mobile.

Brian has presented Progress technology at events both inside and outside the Progress community. He is also currently chairman of the UK and Ireland PUG.

Carl is a lead developer/architect with over 20 years experience with Progress OpenEdge & related products such as Sonic in the supply chain distribution business. From Progress V6 to OpenEdge 11 in character/ADM1//ADM2 with Appserver & Sonic integration. His role involves significant R+D with Progress and other technologies with a view to their successful adoption by the company. He is the architect of the BCP enhanced adm1/2 framework used in the Accord Distribution product and recently built the thin-client checkout infrastructure using Appserver/Sonic to replace the previous Accord Distribution client-server checkout product. As part of a development team at BCP over the past 17 years he has developed many modules including Telesales, Pricing, Central Store Replenishment and Simple Manufacturing thus avoiding an "ivory tower" approach to technology and ensuring any technology can be practically applied. He is currently working with other developers on mobile applications using jQuery Mobile.

Dan Foreman, senior database consultant for BravePoint, has used Progress since 1984. He is recognized worldwide as an expert in Progress Performance Tuning and Database Administration. He has been a guest speaker at the USA Progress Users Conference for more than 20 years.

Dan is the author of several best selling Progress books including the Progress Performance Tuning Guide, the Progress Database Administration Guide, V10 DBA Jumpstart, and Progress System Tables. He has also developed several tools for the Progress database administrators including ProMonitor, Pro Dump & Load, Balanced Benchmark, and the Progress Database Resource Kit.

Gus Bjorklund is a geek who has been at Progress Software since 1989. Currently an Architect in the OpenEdge PRODUCT group, he spends his time on best practices, evangelism, assisting the product marketing folks, and working with the OpenEdge product architects on new stuff.

Over the years Gus has worked on many different parts of the OpenEdge product, starting with version 4.2N. He has also worked with many of the other product development groups at Progress and for several years was part of the Corporate Strategy and Business Development group.

His main focus at Progress has been on the OpenEdge RDBMS. He believes that it is "the best RDBMS on the third planet from the sun" and likes to use Linux and Mac OS X. While he has heard that there are other programming languages, he has strong affinity for the 4GL but still refuses to call it by its current name, the ABL.

Sessie.subject: 217 Days to 27 Hours:  Best Practices in Dump & Load Optimization
Sessie.description: aDump and load times can vary widely: one site called me when their initial tests showed they would need 27 days of down time to dump and load!  After a bit of testing and preparation, we executed in 27 hours. At this session, you will learn the current best practices (and some sneaky tricks) for testing, planning and executing dumps, loads and index rebuilds.  If you've been putting off a migration or upgrade because of the dump and load, or are a DBA looking for a few more tools in your toolbox, then this session is definitely for you!

Sessie.subject: Database Storage for Dummies2
Sessie.description: This presentation will cover disk hardware setup for JBOD, RAID, SAN, NAS.  Most common vendors (HP, EMC, IBM, NetApp, ...) will be discussed with best practices for each vendor provided.  Additionally, OpenEdge storage considerations (Type I vs. Type II, Records per Block and Blocks per Cluster) will be covered in detail.  Simple guidelines for each metric along with ways to reasonably calculate each value.  This presentation would appeal to database and system administrators.  A basic understanding of disk storage is recommended but there should be something for everyone.

Sessie.subject: How to manage 10Â 000 Progress Databases
Sessie.description: Managing several hundreds of Progress DB could be quite a pain in a dedicated environment, dealing with resource problems and a lot of redundant administrative tasks. How about dealing with more than 10 000 Progress DB in a cloud environment? That's quite a challenge, given that no real embedded tools are provided for that purpose. But challenging doesn't mean impossible. We are going to show you that with well designed "homemade" tools, good sense and organization, you could make it too. You are welcome to listen to our little recipe about "cooking" our 12 000 DB, what problems we daily encounter, how we are dealing with them, and what tools we have developed and we are using today

Sessie.subject: Numbers, we don't need no stinking numbers
Sessie.description: Performance numbers matter less than the user experience.  A system can never be fast enough for the users.  This presentation will show how to look at your system from the outside in and determine the most important portions of the application to look at when evaluating performance.  We will also look at those portions of the application that people "think" are important but really don't matter to your customers.  There are numerous cases where the performance statistics for an application look fine but the users are experiencing something completely different.  With a few simple tips you will be able to easily determine if the application is indeed performing poorly or if a user is having a bad day.

Sessie.subject: Performance techniques
Sessie.description: What are the key indicators of problems and poor performance that every database administrator should be tracking? Where do you find this information, and how can you distinguish the urgent from the mundane? We will learn how to approach common monitoring problems through live demonstrations and explain how to get started on the road to proactively managing your database and application.  Join this session to find out the answers to all these questions and more!

Sessie.subject: Progress Database Management- Best Practices
Sessie.description:
The Progress database is marketed as a database that does not require much attention, i.e. it has a low cost of ownership.  However it is a serious mistake to believe that you can ignore the operation of your mission critical databases without substantial risk to the business.  Most Progress databases donÂ’t require a full time database administrator but they do require periodic "care & feeding". This presentation will provide a comprehensive checklist of Best Practices for managing, monitoring, tuning, and protecting your Progress databases.

The session will also help you focus your limited and precious time on what is truly important.  The presenter, Dan Foreman, has been working with Progress for three decades.

Sessie.subject: Progress System Tables
Sessie.description: Virtual System Tables offer a very flexible and powerful way of monitoring Progress databases activity, record locking, user I/O, and more for both local and remote databases.  Unfortunately the lack of adequate documentation makes it difficult to do serious work with VSTs.  This session covers what you won't find in the Progress documentation such as performance issues with VSTs, undocumented VST characteristics, the VST Schema, and how VSTs work. There are other tables in the Progress Database that are not virtual and serve a variety of functions such as the MetaSchema, Query Optimizer, SQL permissions, and much more.  This session will also give an overview of these tables and show how they can be useful to developers and database administrators.

Sessie.subject: Promon - Deep, Deeper, and Deepest
Sessie.description: The promon utility has several "levels" of statistics and as we go deeper, each level is more mysterious and has less documentation than the previous level.  This presentation will take a tour of promonÂ’s deepest parts and attempt to identify what screens and metrics are valuable to a DBA and those that are not.

Sessie.subject: ProTop Version 3 -- An Open Source Progress Database Performance Monitor
Sessie.description: ProTop is a free, Open Source database monitor for Progress OpenEdge databases. ProTop sorts, filters and groups realtime VST data into insightful analysis screens that help to keep your database and application performance in tip top shape. This session will examine ProTop's "out of the box" capabilities. We'll learn how to approach common monitoring problems through live demonstrations and explain how to get started on the road to proactively managing your database and application.

Sessie.subject: Tales from the Audit Trails
Sessie.description: Auditing has been a built-in feature of the OpenEdge database since Version 10 but very few organizations have implemented it yet. This presentation will cover the implementation and impacts of OpenEdge Auditing. Topics covered will include benchmarks of the effects of Auditing on performance and storage and will include tips on effectively managing and using audit data.  There will also be a demonstration showing how to setup auditing and how to build an alerting mechanism on an event.

Sessie.subject: An object lesson in classes
Sessie.description:
This presentation will take you through examples of classes that are used in production and how OO coding can improve code readability, maintenance and re-use.

Intended audience: developers

Outline: various examples of production code will be demonstrated and walked through, with examples of inheritance, interfaces, abstracts and other OO "stuff". There will also be loads of hints and tips for the new (and perhaps older) OO coder.

Sessie.subject: MDD and BRM in a new OE backend framework
Sessie.description:
Do you want to drastically reduce development- and testtime for your business logic? Update a part of your businesslogic without a need for a new software release? Had enough of tedious error-prone work like writing referential checks, checks on unique indexes, cascading deletes etc?

In this presentation the speaker will show how you can create an ERD in an opensource-tool with eclipse-plugin, create a DF and import this while maintaining metadata on relationships between tables and more. You already have a database and do not like to type everything again in the ERD? Of course there is a reverse-engineering possibility.

After that you can quickly create a 'model'  consisting of datasets, temptables, relations, etc. The model is saved in the metadata. You can create validations which are saved into the metadata also (no need to edit for example referential checks or checks on unique indexes. Your customer can even maintain these validations him/herself. Generate the code and testfiles with a push on the button. The speaker will show you how after a change in a tablerelation and import of the change into the database the behaviour of the businesslogic has changed. The used metadata-structure will be shown.

Sessie.subject: Model-Based Development: A Day in the Life
Sessie.description: Model-Based Development for ABL has enormous potential for reducing the time and cost of original development while increasing quality and providing really dramatic improvements in responsiveness to changed requirements.  This presentation describes various development scenarios and describes how Model-Based Development would happen in each environment.

Sessie.subject: Combining Progress OpenEdge, BPM and Corticon to Provide for a maximum of flexibility
Sessie.description:
AKIOMA Software developed an OpendEdge Application for handling the sales process of complex products. It is implemented using OE 11.3 as the Backend with a Browser-based UI and is deployed on-premise as well as cloud based.

AKIOMA enhanced this application by integrating Business Process Management and the Corticon rules engine.

Attendees of this session will see a great example of OpenEdge, including OpenEdge BPM, working in tandem with Corticon to provide competitive advantages as well as increased productivity.

They will learn how they can integrate BPM and rules management into an OE application and which advantages they can gain by doing so. Attendees will also learn how OpenEdge can be used to extend the functionality of Corticon and BPM. They will benefit from tips/tricks and lessons we learned along the way.

Furthermore they will get information about which Tool is the optimal choice for certain use cases, and how to determine the right one, especially in those areas where they do overlap:

* When to implement logic in ABL and when in corticon? why?
* how exactly do processes and rules differ? 
* can they be combined? how?
* which use cases are not a good fit for BPM and/or corticon?

Sessie.subject: ProDatasets - in an out! Or the 10th birthday of a power-feature!
Sessie.description:
ProDatasets were added to the language 10 years ago. Powerful, flexible and still not used as much as they should! ProDatasets are the foundation of successful OERA implementation, AppServer programming, OE Mobile, user interface flexibility, OE BPM, Â…...

In this session we will review basic principles of the ProDataset and introduce complex features such as abstracted data mapping, relation parameters, complex data sources and using the ProDataset for updating the database while remaining flexible and still well performing.

Sessie.subject: System Integration use case: #42 - IP Phone system integrated with ABL applications using Stomp and more
Sessie.description: Summary to be provided.

Sessie.subject: Unraveling the Knot - Understanding Legacy Code Through Modeling
Sessie.description: Most ABL applications have little or no documentation. They rely on "old hands" knowing the code to understand how the application works and where a change must be made.  Without such an "old hand", there is a lot of time wasted reading code to discover what is currently there and a high risk of mistake in making changes.  In this session we will explore tools for understanding what is in existing code by automated creation of UML component models. We'll explore how modeling can help in creating new code which functions correctly with minimal need for revisions because the code doesnÂ’t implement what the user needs.

Sessie.subject: Can you DIG it? A presentation on the DataDigger
Sessie.description:
Now, be honest. How many times have you found yourself writing a little program just to query a few records in the database. And how many times did you open the data dictionary just to see what the name of one particular field was. Or which components an index contains and to see whether it was ascending or descending?

More than once? Then you have a problem, even though you may not know it yet. Meet the DataDigger. A database explorer tool that gives an overview of all tables, fields and indexes and gives you a chance to explore your data with just a few clicks of the mouse. With the DataDigger you can select, filter, query and adjust your data with stunning ease. DataDigger tries to support you as much as possible by remembering settings and queries. Database queries have never been that easy.

Yes, we - programmers - are lazy. And that is good, because tools are supposed to do the work, not you. So see what DataDigger can do for you.

Sessie.subject: OpenEdge code analysis
Sessie.description: From wrong design decisions to memory leaks, and including full table scan, source code analysis can reveal extremely valuable information. The last years have seen a growing number of solutions appear, but unfortunately not so many for OpenEdge. This session will show you the basics of code parsing and syntax trees, examples of rules violations trapped by an OpenEdge analyzer, and ultimately how to gather everything in a SonarSource repository, the leading open-source solution for code analysis.

Sessie.subject: Progress Developer Studio for OpenEdge - Template customization
Sessie.description: Progress Developer Studio for OpenEdge (formerly known as OpenEdge Architect) is a very powerful and flexible development environment. However the templates for creating new procedure or class files and code blocks (new internal procedures, methods, ...) may not match everybodyÂ’s personal preferences, documentation standards or ALM requirements. As the code editor of PDSOE is based on Java the Eclipse JET Template engine allows customizing these templates. This session will introduce JET templates and how they can be used with OpenEdge Architect.

Sessie.subject: Progress Developer Studio in a Team
Sessie.description: Progress Developer Studio for OpenEdge (formerly known as OpenEdge Architect) is a very powerful and flexible development environment. However using the tool successfully with a team of developers on a day by day basis may force the group previously using the Progress ADE (AppBuilder, Procedure Editor) or other tools to rethink their configuration and habits. The presented will outline best and not so good practices about using PDSOE in a team. In this session you will also learn about setting useful preferences and how to share them with colleagues and enforce useful standards.

Sessie.subject: Scheduling, reusing a good engine
Sessie.description: Enterprise job scheduling service offered by open-source Quartz engine can be easily integrated in every Progress based application to serve as a batch processing engine and not only. Used by many open-source business intelligence&reporting suites (Jasper Reports, Pentaho) and even well know commercial products (Atlassian Jira and Confluence) the engine can be fully integrated by using the Progress Application Server and Java Open Client. Store all scheduling information in a Progress database, call-back on Progress Application Server or run custom jobs (start external programs, run reports, call security enabled web-services).

Sessie.subject: SCM best practices for OpenEdge
Sessie.description: Software Configuration Management is not defined by version control alone. From identifying functional application structure and life-cycle stages, to controlling changes of application resources, to creating deployments for end-users, effective SCM will give control, visibility and auditability into the software development process. Using Roundtable TSMS 11.2 for Progress Developers Studio as a basis, this session will explore SCM concepts and their implementation in a demonstration environment. Geared towards both existing Roundtable users and those wanting to learn about software configuration management, this session also provides an overview of the latest plug-in features and how they are used in real-world environment.

Sessie.subject: Aiming for usability, Designing HTML5 and Javascript based user interface architecture for ERP system
Sessie.description:
ERP and Healthcare systems are presented as case studies to demonstrate modular HTML5 architecture layer by layer. Well thought architecture helps to decrease development times and reuse functionality. UI modules can be combined and used as functional prototypes to support usability processes. Following topics are discussed:
* What is usability and common usability processes
Â•* Single page application (SPA) paradigm and responsive layout
Â•* Using JavaScript frameworks to build modular HTML5 applications
Â•* Creating UI prototypes by using offline data 
Â•* REST/JSON based data access through WEBSPEED
Â•* Experiences and best practices

Sessie.subject: Building a hybrid mobile ordering App
Sessie.description:
This session will take you through our experiences on building a mobile ordering website and hybrid App (Google Play/Appstore) using jQuery Mobile, Webspeed & Phonegap to leverage device capabilities such as the camera for bar code scanning.
 
We will cover the UI technology stack used (jQuery Mobile and a bundle of other javascript libraries) along with the backend data handling via Webspeed JSON.  We will build a simple application demonstrating how to build the UI and run business logic on an Openedge databases using Webspeed/JSON.

Sessie.subject: Cloud Developer Studio
Sessie.description:
Nowadays, companies want to develop cross platform applications, without having to learn new languages. To solve this problem and create a unified solution for Web and Mobile applications we use HTML5.

Create nice looking applications on the cloud using a simple UI Designer and a Rapid Application Development language such as OpenEdge ABL. Test your application on the cloud using different devices or operating systems. Code once, store it on cloud, and access it everywhere.

Sessie.subject: Demo Mobile App developed for Avio-Diepen
Sessie.description:
Avio-Diepen is specialized in supply chain management services and distribution of aircraft parts and components to customers throughout the world. The current AOG tool is used by a customer as soon as an aircraft has to stay on the ground because of a defect part. The customer is able to check if the required part is on stock at one of the Avio-Diepen warehouses. If it is, the customer calls the AOG service line (available 24/7) to order the requested part. After receiving the order from the customer,  the part is shipped from the nearest warehouse as soon as possible.

Avio-Diepen wants to improve the order process for AOG parts. Therefore, a mobile app for the customer (ordering the AOG part) and a mobile app for the AOG service employees (handling the AOG quote) has been developed by Caesar Experts using the OE Mobile Appbuilder. During our session, we will not only demonstrate the mobile apps themselves, but also the way the mobile apps are integrated into the existing Progress landscape of Avio-Diepen. Next to that, we will discuss the difficulties we encountered, the solutions found and the lessons learned during the development process.

Sessie.subject: Developing a Real World Application using OpenEdge Mobile
Sessie.description: Self-scanning is big in supermarkets now, allowing customers to avoid queues while saving on checkout staff costs. Up to now, store-provided devices were needed, but OpenEdge Mobile let us develop an app for customers' own Smartphones, saving the cost of devices and allowing the app to move outside the store by adding functionality like shopping lists. This session explores some of the dos and donÂ’ts of developing a complex app using OpenEdge Mobile

Sessie.subject: JavaScript and OpenEdge - Tips and Tricks
Sessie.description:
Javascript is the only language available in a web browser. Hence the web is anywhere; you have to know a few things about this language.

This session will give you tips, how you are able to easily enhance your application with jQuery, async, bootstrap, swig and different other utilities and a small intro in Typescript, the real object oriented Javascript implementation from Microsoft.

Sessie.subject: The Backend for OE Mobile
Sessie.description: OpenEdge 11.3 is here! It provides everything for building hybrid mobile applications for Apples iOS and Android devices. Tools to build the user interface design and logic, bind it to the backend and the REST adapter to actually provide the communication with the OpenEdge AppServer. But what about the backend itself? As usual Progress is very vague on this aspect of the architecture, yet its a key part of every OpenEdge application. This session will showcase the steps that were required to build a working prototype using the OpenEdge 11.3 mobile capabilities to connect an existing OERA framework to mobile phones. The presenter will demonstrate the same business logic for retrieving data, updating data and invoking custom routines being used in various user interfaces. He will highlight what was required to build on the back end especially for supporting the mobile UI.

Sessie.subject: The fastest way to the web with Quarix Framework
Sessie.description: Quarix framework is being developed and sponsored by TSS-Yonder, a European IT solution provider, as an open source solution to the ever growing need for web applications that are running with Progress back end. QuariX for OpenEdge is a full OERA compliant platform for rapid development of Rich Internet Applications together with myStroBe Java Framework. If you are interested in building a faster, modern, rich and responsible application for your business or introducing an older one to the modern era, then Quarix is the best solution.

Sessie.subject: bb
Sessie.description: dd

Sessie.subject: mooi2
Sessie.description: man

Sessie.subject: Opening General Session / Coffee @ Expo / Foyer
Sessie.description: The PUG Challenge Board: Opening General Session / Coffee @ Expo / Foyer

Sessie.subject: Automated database migration
Sessie.description:
After this presentation you will have the opportunity to receive a tool which will enable you to do an automated database migration. The tool itself is a powerful addition to any database administrators set of tools and utilities and can be used for more than only the included database migration. Other possibilities include automated dump-and-load, performing the same script in multiple environments that differ in configuration and creating any custom script.

The included script will enable you to do a database migration from Progress 9 to OpenEdge 11 using a binary dump-and-load, change of database structure and preservation of sequence values in one iteration without needing any interaction from the user. This included script will be used to demonstrate the usage of the tool, which will be available for download after the presentation.

Sessie.subject: Build great mobile business applications on your existing Progress Applications
Sessie.description: Did you every dream of being able to create a cross platform mobile application that would allow to connect to your existing Progress application, reuse your business logic and even work offline? Come to this session to see how easy it is to create mobile applications on top of your existing Progress applications. In this live demo we will take an existing Progress application and from scratch create and deploy a mobile application, native for iOS and for Android. Ready for both smartphone and tablet. Offering offline usage, data synchronisation, local business rules, photo support, email support, phone integration, signature capabilties, barcode integration and more! Don't miss this session to find out how easy it is to mobile enable your existing Progress applications without having to write from scratch.

Sessie.subject: For Desktop, BPM, Cloud and Pacific - introducing the all-purpose framework: SmartComponent Library
Sessie.description: The SmartComponent Library Framework provides a best in class interface on the Desktop, out of the box BPM and BRM integration and provides the deployment flexibility todays businesses require as well providing the legacy code compatibility you may require: On premise or in the cloud with users working on the Desktop, Mobile Devices or the Browser. Recent integrations with Progress Rollbase and Pacific ensure the spark of innovation for your application!

Sessie.subject: Live dashboards for OpenEdge and Pacific, built by anyone, available anywhere
Sessie.description:
DataPA OpenAnalytics is the only complete business intelligence platform built specifically for the Progress community. Whether you are a developer looking for embedded business intelligence to compliment your business application, or an organisation looking for stand alone business intelligence to improve your business practices, you'll be amazed how easy it is to achieve with DataPA OpenAnalytics.

In this session we will address both Progress Application Partners and direct Progress customers, showing how DataPA OpenAnalytics is leading the charge in providing agile business intelligence for the OpenEdge and Progress Pacific community.

We will demonstrate how DataPA OpenAnalytics empowers business users to rapidly create accurate and relevant intelligence about their organisation, published instantly to any stakeholder in real time. By combining rapid, native integration to the application business logic with a powerful live analytics engine and a single click publish to mobile devices and browsers, DataPA OpenAnalytics ensures business users can create agile solutions, allowing their organisation to adapt and respond to events as they happen.

For application partners we will show how our innovative OEM program is allowing an increasing number of Progress Application Partners to exceed customer's expectations, in both presentation and functionality, by rapidly and seamlessly embedding beautiful, real-time dashboards, charts and reports into their OpenEdge and Pacific applications. We recognise that nobody is better placed to deliver a self services business intelligence platform to customers than the business application vendor. We will show how we are helping Progress Application Partners to offer customers a live, self service business intelligence module perfectly tailored to their software and branded as their own.

If you are a Progress Application Partner looking for an easy way to increase your revenue, or a Progress direct customer looking for a quick and easy way to improve the efficiency and agility of your organisation, this is one session not to be missed.

Sessie.subject: Skin-Client Mobile Hands on Workshop
Sessie.description:
IAP's Skin-Client for Mobile enables Progress Developers to become App developers using 100% pure OpenEdge ABL in a remarkably short time frame.

The Skin-Client for Mobile has a "write once, deploy anywhere" approach which means that your code will run natively on iOS and Android and Blackberry and Windows Mobile and J2ME.

The Skin-Client for Mobile removes the need to learn device-specific languages or other development environments and thus saves you valuable time and money in your App creation.

We will provide a Virtual Machine for every attendee so take you laptop and put your hands on Skin-Client Mobile!
Create your first native App in this 2 hour workshop and start to like it :)

IAP, located in Hamburg, northern Germany, is an OpenEdge focused company with priority on consulting, tools and programming for OpenEdge in Europe and world wide. http://www.tools4progress.com/

If you are going to attend this workshop, please bring your own laptop!

Sessie.subject: Soft Transformation Approach - simply something new begins
Sessie.description:
Your Progress application is rock solid and stable, the users like it - but you have the feeling it look a little dusty... and management tells you there is no money and you have no time for changes you would like to do.

Imagine there is something which makes your application look modern and gives you a good starting point for future changes: That is our OpenEdge Soft Transformation Approach.

Our Soft Transformation Approach is a package which gives you immediate results with very low impact on time and very low risk.
It can take ADM(1/2) or other classic style include based application screens and make them an integrated application with modern Look & Feel. This will leave the functionality untouched and gives you a very good starting point for a step by step migration.

We will present this approach, show some live demos and save some time to discuss your case and questions.

IAP, located in Hamburg, northern Germany, is an OpenEdge focused company with priority on consulting, tools and programming for OpenEdge in Europe and world wide. http://www.tools4progress.com/

Sessie.subject: Taking Business Intelligence to a Higher Level
Sessie.description:
The pace and complexity of business increases almost daily. Drawing on real world examples, this session will discuss how effective use of Business Intelligence solutions can keep pace with business today and help to:
* Increase profits
* Control costs
* Identify new opportunities
* Reduce human error
* Automate processes
* Increase customer satisfaction
* React more rapidly to unfolding events

Sessie.subject: Cloudy with Chance of Database
Sessie.description: Internet cloud-based services such as Amazon's Elastic Computing Cloud (EC2) have changed the economics, scalability, and global reach of application deployment. The computing cloud is attractive for both SaaS and enterprise applications and you can use either the Workgroup or Enterprise edition of the OpenEdge RDBMS. Progress Arcade makes it very easy to get started. During this talk, we'll review the technology available for cloud-based deployment, and examine the advantages and the risks. We will demonstrate OpenEdge in the Amazon EC2 environment.

Sessie.subject: Corticon Business Rules Management For OpenEdge
Sessie.description: How do you respond to accelerating change in regulation, competitive pressures, new service offers, customisation and fraud? Are you responsive enough to meet your customers' needs and translate their requirements quickly into new rules that drive applications? Learn why externalising business rules in ProgressÂ® CorticonÂ® can make your Progress OpenEdge application far more agile.

Sessie.subject: Corticon Programming with OE
Sessie.description: Progress OpenEdge 11.3 adds new capabilities to let you easily integrate your OpenEdge application with Progress Corticon. We'll share essential details on how you can integrate the developer experience and use OpenEdge data structures to define business rules to act on. Plus, we'll show you how to see and test changes to the ABL and cover deployment as well.

Sessie.subject: Debugging your OE Mobile App
Sessie.description:
Congratulations! Everyone loved your prototype, and you've got the go ahead for your new OpenEdge Mobile application. They just want one little change, and that change 'somehow' caused everything to break. What do you do?

This session will focus on techniques and options for exploring what is going on with your mobile application under the covers. We will focus on common issues that arise during mobile development. Tools and procedures for looking at behavior, tracking the HTTP traffic, and debugging the JavaScript and HTML5 will be discussed.

Sessie.subject: Getting the most out of your virtualization in OpenEdge environment
Sessie.description: A company that means business nowadays shouldn't be running without virtualization. There is however a difference between simply running a Virtual Infrastructure and realising its full potential and proper implementation, in order to keep the OpenEdge environment fully functioning and database integrity intact. This session will outline and demonstrate how to utilize backup, high availability and distributed resource scheduling, how to configure virtual environments, and discuss pros and cons of virtual HA, DRS, SRM and LiveMotion.

Sessie.subject: Info Exchange
Sessie.description: Join senior members of the Progress OpenEdge product group in an informal discussions that's bound to get lively. Come to this session to discuss Progress' current product plans, provide input on feature enhancements that you would like implemented, and help set the priority of when new features are needed. Tell us what you like and don't like. The session covers everything including the ABL, the OpenEdge database, OpenEdge Architect, the Application Servers, Corticon, Rollbase, etc.

Sessie.subject: Introduction to OpenEdge Mobile
Sessie.description: Learn all about Progress OpenEdge Mobile functionality and what's involved in the flow of mobile execution (e.g. Progress Developer Studio for OpenEdge, REST, OpenEdge Mobile App Builder). Plus, find out how to quickly develop a mobile app and deploy it onto devices (e.g. Android, iOS) directly from PDSOE. We'll also discuss building comprehensive mobile applications using PDSOE.

Sessie.subject: Introduction to Rollbase
Sessie.description: Excited by the main stage announcements and want to learn more about the new Progress Pacific? This session will give an overview of the Progress Pacific platform and show various use cases. It will touch on all aspects of the platform from rapid creation and deployment of powerful business applications that are driven by data and unlimited by device or cloud.

Sessie.subject: OpenEdge Product Roadmap
Sessie.description: Get an overview of Progress' OpenEdge strategy and roadmaps. This will cover high level items related to OpenEdge 11 and major strategic features including: mobile/web UI, OpenEdge BPM, Progress in the Cloud, as well as OpenEdge Architect, OpenEdge RDBMS, and ABL.

Sessie.subject: OpenEdge and Progress Pacific
Sessie.description: You've heard the main stage announcements about Progress Pacific, but how does it impact Progress OpenEdge? What about existing applications, ABL, the AppServer and Progress database? We'll discuss the new announcements and explain what this all means for the future direction of OpenEdge and existing OpenEdge applications. Of course, we'll also leave plenty of time to answer your questions.

Sessie.subject: Licensing and Policies
Sessie.description: Details to follow.

Sessie.subject: Horizontal table partitioning
Sessie.description: Horizontal table partitioning is all about operating on discrete sections of a table for improved runtime performance and maintenance capabilities. Learn how horizontal table partitioning will be incorporated into Progress OpenEdge and get answers to questions on partitioning types, indexing schemes, maintenance capabilities and employing partitioning on your existing data. Plus, you'll get to share your ideas on how this feature can be improved to meet large-data needs.

Sessie.subject: What's new in the 4GL in 11.x
Sessie.description: The ABL team has introduced many new capabilities in Progress OpenEdge 11. In this session, we'll provide an overview of the most essential changes and updates, including a Windows 64 GUI client and support of single-run and singleton procedures via the ABL, and open clients. You'll also get the latest news on improvements to the OOABL, structured error handling, internationalisation infrastructure and more.

Sessie.subject: What's new in the DB in Version 11
Sessie.description: There has been much advancement in the OpenEdge database over the last few years including both prominent well known features and some not so prominent ones all capable of having a big impact to your OpenEdge deployments. In this session you'll hear about the recent improvements in performance, monitoring, on line maintenance, data organisation and governance capabilities available in the OpenEdge database. You can be assured that you'll be introduced to a new capability that will improve your OpenEdge database management.

Sessie.subject: Node.js - Dive deeper inside the web world
Sessie.description: For building web- and mobile-applications, websockets is a new technique to have bidirectional communications between client and server in a web-world. Node.js in combination with a Progress backend with REST-interface, is an ideal solution for high performance web applications. We will show you with examples, how easy it could be to build complex web applications with Progress backend and real mind blowing web frontends.

Sessie.subject: Lunch @ the Expo
Sessie.description: Lunch @ the Expo

Sessie.subject: The Spark of innovation
Sessie.description: The Spark of innovation

Sessie.subject: Coffee break @ the Expo
Sessie.description: Coffee break @ the Expo

Sessie.subject: BOF the new Progress communities
Sessie.description:
Tools don't build communities - People Do!
Be part of the change. Help us create the experience you want.
Collectively, let's build our new enlightening and thriving community.
So get engaged, contribute, share and network with your peers and our staff.
Together we can make it a fun place. Yes we can!

Sessie.subject: BOF session 1
Sessie.description:
Mobile Interfaces
This BOF session will debate the merits of different methods for developing mobile apps, including OpenEdge Mobile and WebSpeed/ JQuery Mobile/ PhoneGap. If you have another alternative, we'd love to hear from you!

OO Info Exchange
Come listen and contribute your feedback on the future of OOABL. Find out where your wish list items are on PSC's priorities and what they understand about the importance and difficulty of each item and how they think the issues should be addressed.

MIP community-source initiative
MIP would like to invite all Progress Partners to share in a new "community-source" project. MIP has developed a suite of business services built entirely on Open Edge and providing a variety of key business services ready for use with your Open Edge application. The services include Workflow, Call Center, Communications, Document Creation and Management, Job Scheduling, Corporate Calendar, and more. Seeking ways to continue development of these services cost effectively, MIP is exploring the possibility of opening this to the Progress Partner Community on an open-source, free to use basis. Would you like to share in growing this platform? Please join us for this discussion and help us see how to make this work for all of us.

Sessie.subject: BOF session 2
Sessie.description:
Mobile Interfaces
This BOF session will debate the merits of different methods for developing mobile apps, including OpenEdge Mobile and WebSpeed/ JQuery Mobile/ PhoneGap. If you have another alternative, we'd love to hear from you!

OO Info Exchange
Come listen and contribute your feedback on the future of OOABL. Find out where your wish list items are on PSC's priorities and what they understand about the importance and difficulty of each item and how they think the issues should be addressed.

MIP community-source initiative
MIP would like to invite all Progress Partners to share in a new "community-source" project. MIP has developed a suite of business services built entirely on Open Edge and providing a variety of key business services ready for use with your Open Edge application. The services include Workflow, Call Center, Communications, Document Creation and Management, Job Scheduling, Corporate Calendar, and more. Seeking ways to continue development of these services cost effectively, MIP is exploring the possibility of opening this to the Progress Partner Community on an open-source, free to use basis. Would you like to share in growing this platform? Please join us for this discussion and help us see how to make this work for all of us.

Sessie.subject: BOF session 3
Sessie.description:
Mobile Interfaces
This BOF session will debate the merits of different methods for developing mobile apps, including OpenEdge Mobile and WebSpeed/ JQuery Mobile/ PhoneGap. If you have another alternative, we'd love to hear from you!

OO Info Exchange
Come listen and contribute your feedback on the future of OOABL. Find out where your wish list items are on PSC's priorities and what they understand about the importance and difficulty of each item and how they think the issues should be addressed.

MIP community-source initiative
MIP would like to invite all Progress Partners to share in a new "community-source" project. MIP has developed a suite of business services built entirely on Open Edge and providing a variety of key business services ready for use with your Open Edge application. The services include Workflow, Call Center, Communications, Document Creation and Management, Job Scheduling, Corporate Calendar, and more. Seeking ways to continue development of these services cost effectively, MIP is exploring the possibility of opening this to the Progress Partner Community on an open-source, free to use basis. Would you like to share in growing this platform? Please join us for this discussion and help us see how to make this work for all of us.

Sessie.subject: DBAppraise: Proactive monitoring for OpenEdge Environments
Sessie.description: PROMON, SAR, Windows Performance Monitor, VSTs. In a sea of data, how do you choose that to watch and what you can safely ignore? Once you know what to look at you will need to understand what things mean. This presentation will show you how you can view the most important metrics and make real decisions based on what you see. At White Star Software and DBAppraise we are in the trenches every day and have to make sense of it all to allow our clients to be successful. We have experience with some of the largest and busiest OpenEdge environments and regardless of your environment we can show you how we work in the field and provide you with insight into your systems.

Sessie.subject: Panel: Top 10 Enhancements in OpenEdge 10 and OpenEdge 11
Sessie.description: Panel: Top 10 Enhancements in OpenEdge 10 and OpenEdge 11

Sessie.subject: Coffee break and closing general session @ the Expo
Sessie.description: Coffee break and closing general session @ the Expo

Sessie.subject: Real World Database Problems, Real World Database Solutions
Sessie.description: Bravepoint sees many customers and encounters many unique problems. This session will cover case studies of some of the more interesting database issues and the technologies required to solve real world problems seen over the past 18 months. This will be a highly interactive session where audience participation is encouraged. At the end of the session you will be better prepared to handle database issues, large or small, that come your way.

Sessie.subject: Understanding Operating System Performance Metrics
Sessie.description: CPU, memory and disk bottlenecks: we hear about them all the time! Unfortunately, many people are not sure how to interpret the data coming out of the various performance monitoring tools. Sar, vmstat, iostat, nmon, topas, glance all of these tools throw screen after screen of numbers at you but cannot tell you if the values are good or bad. This session will explain how to interpret the data so that you can more easily identify system bottlenecks.

Sessie.subject: Festive Evening Event @ the Expo / Foyer / First Floor conference rooms
Sessie.description: Festive Evening Event @ the Expo / Foyer / First Floor conference rooms

Sessie.subject: SmartDox: automated ABL class reference generation
Sessie.description:
SmartDox: Automated Code Documentation for ABLThe SmartDox utility does provide automated generation of complete class reference web sites for your ABL classes. It's based on the OpenEdge Architect parser to ensure always being kept up to date with new language features, sources its comments completely from the ABL source code to ensure there's only a single source to the generated documentation. The utility is customizable, extensible and last but not least free and open-source.

Outline:

* Demonstration SmartDox
* Comment writing rules to ensure maximum results
* Step by Step review of the documentation generation process
* Setup of the ANT environment
* Setup of the ABL part
* HTML Template customization
* Other customization options

Sessie.subject: Continuous integration using Roundtable TSMS
Sessie.description: The Roundtable TSMS API and proxy framework allows for much flexibility in your continous integration strategy while providing means to automate development and deployment processes. In this session, we will discuss continuous integration tools, strategies, and where Roundtable TSMS fits in.

Sessie.subject: On Modernization Strategies for Legacy Enterprise Software Systems
Sessie.description: It is a known fact that the world of IT is constantly changing. This change brings on one hand opportunities that boil down to better business conditions, but also some challenges. Among the biggest ones are the risks and costs surrounding the modernization of legacy enterprise software systems. In this session the most common and effective modernization strategies will be showcased with a focus on real world examples and best practices based on Yonder's extensive experience in this field such as how to realistically estimate the effort required for such endeavors. If you want to know what options are out there for an optimal modernization of your current software solution you should not miss this talk!

Sessie.subject: How TVH improved business operations thanks to more insight in their data using QlikView
Sessie.description: In this session TVH will present and demonstrate how they improved their business operations thanks to the effortless processing of large data volumes with QlikView. In 4 weeks time, they implemented QlikView for 40 users across 4 functional areas. TVH will show how they are now better able to manage the millions of data records in its AS/400 system and in the Oracle and Progress databases.

Sessie.subject: Innovate your products and make them available anywhere using Progress Pacific
Sessie.description:
Did you ever wonder if your business can exist in the cloud? Have you ever thought about innovating your business application, expending it and making it more accessible? Just imagine a platform that can give you the perfect mix of rapid development supported by OpenEdge with the data power provided by DataDirect, all served with a flavor of quick deployment to any platform or device provided by Rollbase.

See how easy it is to move your application to the cloud and take advantages of all the features provided by Progress Pacific in the session demo.

If you are wondering if your business can thrive in the cloud or if you are just curios on how you can integrate products like OpenEdge, DataDirect, and RollBase, then by all means join this session.

Sessie.subject: Mobile Applications: The next step for your business
Sessie.description:
Did you know that there are more than 1.5 billion mobile devices in the world? Is your business ready to face this challenge? Just imagine the impact your business will have on this people's lives after you will create your mobile version of the product.

In this session you can find out how to take this big leap into the future. We will build a mobile application based on existing progress application so you will be able to see the steps, advantages and disadvantages of this process.

If you are considering building mobile applications and you would like some inspiration, or if you are just stuck and need guidance, then joining this session is a must.

Sessie.subject: Paradigm Shift in Test Automation
Sessie.description:
As early as the 80s and 90s, test automation was widely lauded, although prematurely, as the silver bullet for the ever-growing cost of testing.

Today, many companies have become disillusioned with automated testing. Mostly, the initial high expectations have not been met, and the maintenance effort for automated testing has often been greatly underestimated.

In this presentation the concept of Business Dynamic Steering is introduced which eliminates unnecessary maintenance effort and minimizes unavoidable maintenance cost. These strategies are made possible by a paradigm shift in test automation powered by TOSCA Test Suite of TRICENTIS.

With its dynamic steering concept, the TOSCA Test Suite marks a paradigm shift in automated software testing. Dynamic steering is a business-based description of automated test cases without scripts and is globally unique. Automated tests in TOSCA Test Suite can be created and executed without any technical skills. As a side benefit of dynamic steering, the test becomes what it should always have been: a business-based task.

This substantial reduction of maintenance effort enables a multiplication of the coverage of automated tests: while traditional test tools typically provide test coverage of around 30%, companies applying Business Dynamic Steering can routinely reach up to 80%.

The only one of its kind on the market, TOSCA eliminates the necessity of developing specific frameworks. This leads to a significant reduction of the total cost of ownership in automated software testing.
